title: Chief Justice’s potential infection may delay talk with Bolsonaro
text: The dialogue that President Jair Bolsonaro intends to have with the Federal Supreme Court (STF) to try to cool down the ongoing institutional crisis faces a new obstacle: Chief Justice Dias Toffoli could have covid-19. He is stable, under observation, and breathing without a ventilator. He will be away on medical leave for at least seven days. The result of the test is expected for the next few days. The minister has told people close to him that he intends to leave open a channel of dialogue with Mr. Bolsonaro to try to avoid the deepening of the crisis among the powers after a video of a cabinet meeting that took place on April 22 revealed attacks on the STF. He is virtually Mr. Bolsonaro’s only link with Brazil’s highest court. Sources say Mr. Toffoli considers there is room to discuss with the government two matters of institutional concern: the permanence of Abraham Weintraub in office, which displeases the court since the Education minister called for the arrest of STF justices; and the possible seizure of Mr. Bolsonaro’s cell phone for investigation.
